name: Full Sit Outs
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight.
2. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine, feeling a slight contraction in the muscles of your abs.
3. Slowly lift your torso up off the ground, keeping your shoulders down and away from your ears, and hold the position for 1-2 seconds.
4. Lower your torso back down to the starting position, taking 1-2 seconds to return to the lying position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your core engaged throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Full sit outs are an abdominal exercise targeting the upper abs and lower back muscles.
